meanings.definition: A person who is devoted to the pursuit of wealth and material possessions.
meanings.sent1: The mammonists in the city always talk about money and expensive things.
meanings.sent2: The mammonists at the conference were only interested in discussing profits and investments.
meanings.sent3: The mammonists joked that their idea of a treasure hunt would involve finding the best deals at the mall.
meanings.sent4: Her office was like a gathering of mammonists, each trying to outdo the other in displaying their wealth.
meanings.sent5: The mammonists' eyes gleamed with greed as they counted their stacks of cash.

meanings.definition: Those who prioritize money and material gain above all else.
meanings.sent1: The mammonists in the neighborhood flaunted their luxury cars and designer clothes.
meanings.sent2: To the mammonists, success was measured solely by the size of their bank accounts.
meanings.sent3: The mammonists were so obsessed with money that they even dreamed in dollar signs.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, the mammonists were like sharks, always chasing the next big deal.
meanings.sent5: The mammonists' hearts beat faster at the sight of a lucrative investment opportunity.
